intro: Garnotia zelanica, commonly known as the Zelanic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, hairy stems with lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
